response_parsed.title: Testing Strategies for Base64 Code with pytest in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This document outlines effective testing strategies for Base64 encoding and decoding functions using the pytest framework in Python 3.12+.
key_points: Leverage pytest fixtures for setup and teardown to manage test data and environment
Use the built-in assert functions to check expected results of Base64 operations
Test both encoding and decoding functionalities separately
Create tests that cover edge cases like invalid input, empty strings, and maximum input size limits
Implement mocking techniques for external dependencies, if any
Consider using third-party libraries like pytest-base64 or base64-pytest to simplify testing Base64 functions

code_examples.code:
def test_encode(encoded_fixture):
    assert base64.b64encode(bytes('Hello, World!', 'utf-8')).decode() == encoded_fixture

version_notes: Pytest version 7.0 and above is recommended for using the fixtures feature
The base64 module comes built-in in Python 3.12+, so no additional dependencies are required for basic Base64 tests
caveats: Ensure test data includes a variety of characters to cover different encoding scenarios
Keep testing coverage high to ensure that both the encoding and decoding functions work as expected in all cases
